message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $13,000. It's a great deal for you, and I'm confident it's worth every penny. What do you think?
Hi Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $10,000. I'm really interested in the product, but I need to stay within a certain budget. Can you meet me halfway?

Bob, I understand you're on a budget, but $10,000 is too low for me. How about we split the difference and go with $11,500? It's still a good deal for you, and it gives me some room to work with. Let's get this done!
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $11,500 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer $11,000. Can you consider that?
Bob, I'm really trying to work with you here, but $11,000 just doesn't cut it for me.  Let's go with $11,250. It's a fair compromise and allows me to move forward. What do you say?
Alice, I understand you're trying to make a deal, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to go up to $11,100. Can you meet me at that price?

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $11,100 is still just a bit too low.  I'm willing to come down to $11,150. This is my final offer. If you're not able to meet this price, I'll unfortunately have to move on to another buyer.
Alice, I understand this is your final offer, but I'm really close to my budget. I'm willing to go up to $11,125. Can you reconsider and meet me at this price?
